original: Anderberg, Nils Johan Anton, civilingenjör, direktör, Göteborg, f. 18/6/82 i Vä förs., Krist. 1., av Johan A. o. Karna Nilsson. G. 11 m. Alfhild Janson. Barn: Anne-Marie f. 12. — CTH 03, Polytechnicum i Zürich 04. Stud:-res. t. Tyskl., Engl., Österr., Ungern, Finl. o. Schweiz. Bitr. ing. v. Gbgs byggn :kont. 04, e. arb :chef v. gatu- o. vägförvaltn. i Gbg 10, ord. arb :chef där 15-25, dir. f. Gbgs stads renhålln:v. sed. 25. Sekr. i Tekn. samf. avd. f. väg- o. vattenbyggn. 17-21, led. av styr. f. Sv. kommun :tekn. fören., led. av Inst. of Public Cleansing o. av Inter-nat. Public Cleansing Comm., v. preses v. internat. renhålln :kongr. i Frankfurt am Main 35. Skr.: Nytt kloaksystem f. delar av Gbg (18), Renhållningsstyrelsens minnesskrift 1882-1932 (32) samt ett 30-tal art. i renhåll-n:frågor i sv. o. uti. facktidskr. KV02kl, FMM.
translated: Anderberg, Nils Johan Anton, engineer, director, Gothenburg, born June 18, 1882 in Vä parish, Christianstad, son of Johan A. and Karna Nilsson. Married for 11 years to Alfhild Janson, they have a daughter named Anne-Marie, born in 1912. He studied at CTH 03 and Polytechnicum in Zurich in 04. He took study trips to Germany, England, Austria, Hungary, Finland, and Switzerland. He was an assistant engineer at Gothenburg's building office in 04, and became the road and road maintenance manager in Gothenburg in 10, chief of work there from 15-25, and director of the Gothenburg City Cleaning Department since 1925. He was a secretary of the Technical Society in the department for road and water engineering from 17-21, a member of the board of the Swedish Municipal Technical Association, a member of the Institute of Public Cleansing and the International Public Cleansing Committee. He was also the chairperson at the International Cleaning Congress in Frankfurt am Main in 35. He wrote papers on a new sewage system in parts of Gothenburg (18), the memorial booklet of the Cleaning Committee 1882-1932 (32), and about 30 articles on cleaning issues in Swedish and foreign specialist journals.
